page.title: 05HOUSING IN STOTTESDON AREA
page.content: About 70% of homes lie in the{village. There is a{sewerage system,}but more remote houses have septic tanks. {Council houses}have been built in 3 phases in 1940s, 50s & 70s. The latest are bungalows for O.A.Ps. Over 1/2 the homes are pre 1900, most 18th or 19th century but some as old as 1100. Over 60% are{owner occupied. All houses have mains{electricity}& only 2 lack mains{water.}There is no mains{gas.}Over 80% use electricity for cooking but bottled/tank gas, oil & solid fuel are also used. No home lacks{bathroom}or inside{toilet.}All have{gardens,}usually of such a size that they have a powered lawn mower. Nobody is without a{T.V.}Few have no fridge, freezer or washing machine, & computers, C.B radios, video cameras/ recorders are also to be found. Less than 10% are not on the{telephone.
